Tata Motors (down 5.03%) was the top loser on Nifty 50 index and was followed by ONGC (down 4.04%), Tata Steel (down 3.86%), Hindalco (down 3.81%) and IndusInd Bank (down 3.39%)

data.author: Miriam Boston, Correspondent
data.title: Students on stocks
data.description:
Many students decided to invest in the stock market yesterday and today with some unlikely stocks on the rise such as GameStop, AMC and Robinhood. 
The Stock Market is comprised of the collection of buyers and sellers investing in stocks, and stocks are shares of ownership in a public company.
We wanted to hear what our campus thought of the stock situation that’s happening now so we asked around.
“I feel like it’s great that people are learning to invest and that they are seeing the amount of pull they have on the market, when we all put our money in one place”, said former GS student Nazir Louis. “At the same time it’s sad that a lot of these big brokers are regulating trading in an effort to stop everyday citizens from taking advantage of the market.”
“Well yes I have invested in many stocks over the past couple of months and also invest so much a month in stock dollars”, said GS student Jazmin Jenkins.  
 Jenkins’ overall opinions on its rise are positive but remain skeptical. “since I’m making money doing absolutely nothing. However, I have noticed lately a lot of stock has been in the red which means it’s decreasing as we speak. Which makes it hard to determine what company I would like to make my next investment.” said Jenkins.
